meanings.definition: A small, flat case for carrying paper money, cards, and other small personal items.
meanings.sent1: My dad keeps his money and cards in his notecase.
meanings.sent2: She bought a new notecase to organize her cards.
meanings.sent3: The notecase was so full, it looked like a mini suitcase!
meanings.sent4: Her notecase was a treasure trove of memories.
meanings.sent5: The shiny notecase caught everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: To put or keep in a notecase.
meanings.sent1: He would notecase his important documents for safekeeping.
meanings.sent2: She carefully notecased the receipt in her wallet.
meanings.sent3: I notecased the note so securely, I couldn't find it later!
meanings.sent4: The idea was notecased in his mind, never to be forgotten.
meanings.sent5: She notecased the memory in her heart forever.
